original_title: Proposals to reduce electricity tariffs to be handed to the PUCSL
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Ceylon Electricity Board said it will hand over the proposals to reduce electricity tariffs to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka on Friday (12).
CEB spokesperson Engineer Noel Priyantha said measures are being taken to allow people to benefit from the increased hydropower generation.
He added that the capacity of reservoirs related to power plants has increased to 96 percent.
Minister of Water Supply Jeevan Thondaman said the water tariffs will also be reduced along with the reduction of the electricity tariffs.
